Measurement Errors (sorts.radar.measurement_errors)#

Description#

By default, SORTS simultations and computations assume free-space propagation of the signals and ignore sources of noise outside of the receiver noise (see receiver noise temperature). To reduce the impact of those strong assumptions, SORTS Measurement Errors (sorts.radar.measurement_errors) module includes a set of functions and classes which defines a standard interface to add random measurement errors to data and propagate uncertainties.

API Reference#

1. The Errors class#

The errors.Errors class defines a standardized interface to add random errors to data. It is the base class from which all the other errorr-related classes inherit.

Errors([seed])

Defines a standardized interface to add random errors to data.

2. Signal propagation errors#

SORTS Signals (sorts.radar.signals) module assumes free-space propagation of electromagnetic waves. This assumption, while greatly simplifying computations for simple proof-of-concept applications, is not sufficient to simulate real-world radar performances and observations. Therefore, SORTS also inculdes a set of signal propagation error simulations modules :

linearized_coded

Errors

ionospheric_ray_trace

Ionospheric radio propagation effects studied using ray-tracing.

Example#

This simple example showcases the use of the LinearizedCoded class to compute the perturbations in range measurements due to Signal-to-Noise Ratio fluctuations.

results
